ratings.comment: Awesome teacher! Generous for giving A.

Jun is a good professor. I totally disagree with some of the poor ratings. I appreciate his help throughout the semester. I was close to an AB but he did reward hard working. I learnt a lot not from his knowledge of Stochastic Processes, but also his knowledge of life in general. Recommended this course but be ready to work hard.
materials are hard and the curve is very weird. if your final score is between 84  60 you get a B. 8590 get AB and 90+ get A
You don't need to be good at math to get at least an AB in his class. Curve very generously!

Yin's accent isn't too hard to understand, but sometimes he will mix up words, which can lead to confusion. The material is presented pretty clearly for the most part, although it seemed to me that he expected students to be able to follow everything perfectly. The exams aren't too hard, but there's not much of a curve because of this.
Could not understand most of his speaking, heavy accent. Material did not always pertain to the book. Honestly the worst professor I've had so far.
Speaks pretty good English and is funny.  He makes Calc class interesting and relevant to where you will use it.  Grading is very generous and homework is just the right amount.

For engineers and science majors, he's really good at making calc relevant although his English isn't so great. The tests were really basic level, but even if you don't do well on them, the homework (for which there is a solution manual) counts for a lot and he curves the class like nobody's business. Like an insane curve. Insane.
Very good at introducing and explaining topics. Only assigns as much homework as necessary, there is very little busywork.  Excellent overall

quite good teacher. Although most of his lecture is not required in the exam, but it's still a lot fun to listen, especially if you are science major. And his exams are not hard AT ALL, if you don't make any very stupid mistakes. And his is really a good teach to build your confidence in math, esp calculus

A professor graduated from Physics science to teach Math, that's the best thing you can have. He make the HW in level 2, practice exam in level 3, but the real exam in level 1 - he is giving you the A. (ps: top 25% is A, not seen in any other course likes that in my life)

I have always liked his personality, and after a while I got used to how he explains concepts. If you are comfortable with previous math courses then you should be able to follow him For the most part I thought he's great! Homework not demanding at all, it's just enough.
Excellent professor.  Really goes through and explains everything clearly.
